name: Lavenham to Long Melford Railway Walk, Lavenham Guildhall

ai.summary: A 10.6 km moderate rail-trail hike from Lavenham to Long Melford along a disused railway line, offering flat walking, countryside scenery, and village highlights such as Lavenham Guildhall along the route.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat to gently undulating gravel and compact-earth surfaces along the old railway corridor. Expect some grassy or muddy sections after rain, occasional gates, and well-marked waymarkers. Surfaces are generally even but can be uneven near woodland edges.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on the marked path as this follows a former railway line; be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared sections. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; check the forecast and daylight hours. Carry a map or offline GPS, water, and snacks. Mobile reception can be patchy in rural areas. Be prepared for muddy patches after rain and gates or stiles at crossings; carry a light if walking near dusk.

seo.title: Lavenham to Long Melford Railway Walk – 10.6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 10.6 km Lavenham to Long Melford Railway Walk, a moderate countryside hike along a former railway line with village highlights near Lavenham Guildhall. Plan your day with tips and gear.
